page.title: 12DARTMOUTH'S NEW EMBANKMENT
page.content: Much of central Dartmouth was once under water and has been{reclaimed over the centuries.{The New Embankment {Scheme}continues this process by extending much of the {Embankment out another{6}metres into the{River. The Project was begun in December 1984 and should be completed in April 1986, at a cost of{Â£2 1/4 million.}It will have used over 99O girders weighing a total of 1,5OO tonnes, and employed{3O}men from Tilbury, plus {5}supervisors and{5}consultants. When the scheme is complete, all {sewers}will have one outfall in the middle of the River. The raised level of the Embankment should prevent any {flooding}during extremely high tides. The river entrance to the{Boat Float is being fitted with flood gates operated automatically by a mercury switch, before{tides}become too high.
